metadata.Title: CVE-2023-38802 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
FRRouting FRR 7.5.1 through 9.0 and Pica8 PICOS 4.3.3.2 allow a remoteattacker to cause a denial of service via a crafted BGP update with acorrupted attribute 23 (Tunnel Encapsulation).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38802` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

frr - 8.1-1ubuntu1.5
frr-pythontools - 8.1-1ubuntu1.5
frr-rpki-rtrlib - 8.1-1ubuntu1.5
frr-snmp - 8.1-1ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: frr package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.1-1ubuntu1.5').
